{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:56.639

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:59.519
    | text      = Manufacturing Consent is about the media, but it's not necessarily about staging events
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:03.559
    | text      = or false flags or that kind of stuff, the way Alex is kind of leading it and presenting
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:08.160

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:09.160
    | text      = Yeah, yeah, yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:10.160
    | text      = The general thesis of Chomsky's book, largely co-written by Edward Herman, is that the media
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:13.559
    | text      = engages in self-censoring of ideas that are opposed to the interests of the elite corporations
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:18.200
    | text      = in such a way that encourages acceptance of the policies being put in place by the government,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:22.759
    | text      = which support those interests, often to the detriment of what's in the interest of normal
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:27.400
    | text      = people.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:28.400
    | text      = It's more complicated than even what I'm presenting, but that's a large part of what Chomsky and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:33.119
    | text      = Herman called the propaganda model.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:35.559
    | text      = It doesn't rely on coercion to operate, rather it's a product of just market forces.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:40.599
    | text      = There's a structural conflict of interest in how the media is organized that creates
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:43.859
    | text      = a disconnect between conveying all of the information that's relevant to the interests
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:47.299
    | text      = of the upper upper classes and those of everyone else.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:51.059
    | text      = This is the general 30,000 foot view of the manufacturing concept.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:56.200
    | text      = Yeah, if the media were capable of reporting correctly they would be reporting every single
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:01.339

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = their entire journalism is pointless.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:12.640
    | text      = but I can tell you that I'm also certain that Alex has not read it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:16.440
    | text      = The propaganda model includes five filters, which are theorized as being determinative
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:20.400

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:23.480
    | text      = effort.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:24.480

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:29.480
    | text      = Business leaders, intellectuals, academic social scientists and others say that it is

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:39.599

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:46.880
    | text      = They're supposed to be directed to other concerns and not interfere with policy formation.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:54.720
    | text      = That is a major phenomenon developed in the more democratic countries, in the United States
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:00.720
    | text      = and England particularly, through the 20th century.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:04.880
    | text      = And the reason was very clear.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:06.880
    | text      = By the early 20th century, it was becoming very difficult to control people by other
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:13.440
    | text      = means.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:15.440
    | text      = The voting franchise was extending, labor unions were developing, women were demanding
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:22.039
    | text      = the vote.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:23.039
    | text      = I mean, the countries, especially England and the United States, were simply becoming
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:26.720

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:28.400

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:41.599
    | text      = People don't like the term propaganda anymore, but that was used.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:44.960
    | text      = That's where the US public relations is.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:47.759
    | text      = It grows out of these experiences and this understanding and it is very explicit.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:52.440

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
